Crowded Bazaar (on the beautiful red carpet)
This is a crowded, noisy bazaar. Directly in front of you is a lottery!  But the contemptuous-looking barker is doing a very poor trade: hardly anyone wants his first prize, the big cuddly toy elephant, or even his nineteenth prize, a featureless white cube.

Behind the barker is a huge drilled board, and inside each little numbered hole is a rolled-up lottery ticket.

"This could be your lucky day!"

Track, outside Temple

You stand outside an enormous temple in the shape of a perfect, featureless white cube, four hundred feet on a side. From somewhere within you hear the tiny sound of the monks chanting.

Far above you, a tortoise flaps across the sun.
next_state: Using your best study habits, you commit the frotz spell to memory.

state: Using your best study habits, you commit the frotz spell to memory.
next_state:
The temple shakes and white light bathes you. Smoothly it unfolds itself in a four-dimensional way your senses can barely comprehend. All you know is that when it is over, you find yourself in...

Balance Room
This seems to be the inside of a featureless white cube, forty feet on a side. The air is stale and there is no exit.

The image of a pair of scales hangs high in the air. One pan is much lower than the other.

Far below the scales, in the centre of the "floor", is a predictably-shaped podium, but it is so dusty and cobwebbed that you can't see what it once was.

[Your score has just gone up by five points.]

next_state: No substitute for old-fashioned hard work, sometimes, and after much patient (sneezy) scrubbing, the podium appears in its true white glory. Set into it are four sockets, arranged in a two by two square.

state: The cube is a predictably perfect fit in the socket.
action: put cave cube in bottom right socket

state: The cube is a predictably perfect fit in the socket.
action: put mace cube in top right socket
next_state:
As you place the final cube into the sockets, you feel imbued with celestial wisdom (more so than usually). You find yourself growing to the height of the cube, so that you pull the balances back level by hand, and then you grow still further, out of the temple until it is but a cube in your hand, and you are a giant towering over the land. 

Then, of course, you wake up, glumly realising it's time to go to your job at the new Borphee Laboratories and all those Wheatstone bridge experiments. But at least you can dream about the old days.


    *** You have won ***


In that game you scored 50 out of a possible 51, in 122 turns, earning you the rank of Scientist.

[Welcome to a short story called "Balances", one of the example games for the Inform design system. Some people may recognise the setting, but others might like to type "how do spells work" - the game responds to a few such questions.] 

You feel a little confused as to how you got here. Something to do with Helistar!  That's right, and how the world is so far off balance nowadays, after the Great Change.

Ramshackle Hut
Until quite recently, someone lived here, you feel sure. Now the furniture is matchwood and the windows are glassless. Outside, it is a warm, sunny day, and grasslands extend to the low hills on the horizon.

state: A pair of handsome brown wings suddenly appears on the horse's powerful shoulders. The horse turns in a complete circle, a look of puzzlement on his face.
next_state:
You begin to ride north. Then, slowly at first but with increasing sureness, the horse begins beating its powerful wings. You rise majestically through the air, sailing gracefully across a chasm where the hills fall away. The horse lands gently on the far side and deposits you, taking to the skies again.

Edge of Chasm
The road ends suddenly at a wide chasm. The road leads upward to the north, and you can see it continuing on the southern side of the chasm.

Lying in a tight coil at the edge of the chasm is a hissing snake.

The snake appears to be curled around a featureless white cube.

state:
Cave Mouth
This is a cave mouth, at one end of a road which winds southeast over rising ground. The entrance west to the caves is a dark tunnel, and only a footpath runs further north, into gorse.
A heavy iron door bars the cave mouth.

Clotted in the mud beside the door is a perfect sapphire.
next_state: Taken.

state: Taken.
next_state: As you gaze into the perfect blue of the sapphire, you feel your mind begin to reel. Unable to bear the naked sight of perfection, you look away, ashamed. As you do so, the sapphire cracks and wastes away to thin hot dust. But something remains, something in your mind...

state: As you gaze into the perfect blue of the sapphire, you feel your mind begin to reel. Unable to bear the naked sight of perfection, you look away, ashamed. As you do so, the sapphire cracks and wastes away to thin hot dust. But something remains, something in your mind...
next_state:
Gorse Bushes
The footpath from the cave mouth runs into dense, impenetrable gorse bushes. Perhaps it wasn't so much a footpath as a rill in the earth where roots wouldn't take; anyway, there's no way but back south.

Slung over one of the gorse bushes is a beautiful red carpet.

state:
There is an almost blinding flash of light as the silver coin begins to glow!  It slowly fades to a less painful level, but the silver coin is now quite usable as a light source.

Inside Cave
A wide but shallow cave not far inside the hill. There is no obvious exit, except for the way you came in.

The iron door stands open.

Balanced on a rock formation is a featureless white cube.

A fair-sized pair of scales hangs from a bracket in the cave wall. The scales are balanced.

On the right pan are three gold coins.

On the left pan are a bronze coin, two gold coins and a crumpled scroll.

Crowded Bazaar (on the beautiful red carpet)
This is a crowded, noisy bazaar. Directly in front of you is a lottery!  But the contemptuous-looking barker is doing a very poor trade: hardly anyone wants his first prize, the big cuddly toy elephant, or even his nineteenth prize, a featureless white cube.

"This could be your lucky day!"

state:
The carpet rises suddenly into the fluffy white clouds, and after a headlong journey deposits you...

Crowded Bazaar (on the beautiful red carpet)
This is a crowded, noisy bazaar. Directly in front of you is a lottery!  But the contemptuous-looking barker is doing a very poor trade: hardly anyone wants his first prize, the big cuddly toy elephant, or even his nineteenth prize, a featureless white cube.

Behind the barker is a huge drilled board, and inside each little numbered hole is a rolled-up lottery ticket.

"Come on, then!  Just a silver coin gets you three!"

state: Using your best study habits, you commit the frotz spell to memory.
next_state:
The temple shakes and white light bathes you. Smoothly it unfolds itself in a four-dimensional way your senses can barely comprehend. All you know is that when it is over, you find yourself in...

Balance Room
This seems to be the inside of a featureless white cube, forty feet on a side. The air is stale and there is no exit.

The image of a pair of scales hangs high in the air. One pan is much lower than the other.

Far below the scales, in the centre of the "floor", is a predictably-shaped podium, but it is so dusty and cobwebbed that you can't see what it once was.

[Your score has just gone up by five points.]

next_state:
As you place the final cube into the sockets, you feel imbued with celestial wisdom (more so than usually). You find yourself growing to the height of the cube, so that you pull the balances back level by hand, and then you grow still further, out of the temple until it is but a cube in your hand, and you are a giant towering over the land. 

Then, of course, you wake up, glumly realising it's time to go to your job at the new Borphee Laboratories and all those Wheatstone bridge experiments. But at least you can dream about the old days.


    *** You have won ***


In that game you scored 50 out of a possible 51, in 122 turns, earning you the rank of Scientist.

state:
[Welcome to a short story called "Balances", one of the example games for the Inform design system. Some people may recognise the setting, but others might like to type "how do spells work" - the game responds to a few such questions.] 

You feel a little confused as to how you got here. Something to do with Helistar!  That's right, and how the world is so far off balance nowadays, after the Great Change.


BALANCES

Ramshackle Hut
Until quite recently, someone lived here, you feel sure. Now the furniture is matchwood and the windows are glassless. Outside, it is a warm, sunny day, and grasslands extend to the low hills on the horizon.
next_state:

next_state: A pair of handsome brown wings suddenly appears on the horse's powerful shoulders. The horse turns in a complete circle, a look of puzzlement on his face.

state: A pair of handsome brown wings suddenly appears on the horse's powerful shoulders. The horse turns in a complete circle, a look of puzzlement on his face.
next_state:
You begin to ride north. Then, slowly at first but with increasing sureness, the horse begins beating its powerful wings. You rise majestically through the air, sailing gracefully across a chasm where the hills fall away. The horse lands gently on the far side and deposits you, taking to the skies again.

Edge of Chasm
The road ends suddenly at a wide chasm. The road leads upward to the north, and you can see it continuing on the southern side of the chasm.

Lying in a tight coil at the edge of the chasm is a hissing snake.

The snake appears to be curled around a featureless white cube.

The footpath from the cave mouth runs into dense, impenetrable gorse bushes. Perhaps it wasn't so much a footpath as a rill in the earth where roots wouldn't take; anyway, there's no way but back south.

Inside Cave
A wide but shallow cave not far inside the hill. There is no obvious exit, except for the way you came in.

The iron door stands open.

Balanced on a rock formation is a featureless white cube.

A fair-sized pair of scales hangs from a bracket in the cave wall. The scales are balanced.

On the right pan are three gold coins.

On the left pan are a bronze coin, two gold coins and a crumpled scroll.

(the beautiful red carpet)
The carpet rises suddenly into the fluffy white clouds, and after a headlong journey deposits you...

Crowded Bazaar (on the beautiful red carpet)
This is a crowded, noisy bazaar. Directly in front of you is a lottery!  But the contemptuous-looking barker is doing a very poor trade: hardly anyone wants his first prize, the big cuddly toy elephant, or even his nineteenth prize, a featureless white cube.

Behind the barker is a huge drilled board, and inside each little numbered hole is a rolled-up lottery ticket.

"This could be your lucky day!"

state:
The temple shakes and white light bathes you. Smoothly it unfolds itself in a four-dimensional way your senses can barely comprehend. All you know is that when it is over, you find yourself in...

Balance Room
This seems to be the inside of a featureless white cube, forty feet on a side. The air is stale and there is no exit.

The image of a pair of scales hangs high in the air. One pan is much lower than the other.

Far below the scales, in the centre of the "floor", is a predictably-shaped podium, but it is so dusty and cobwebbed that you can't see what it once was.

[Your score has just gone up by five points.]
next_state: No substitute for old-fashioned hard work, sometimes, and after much patient (sneezy) scrubbing, the podium appears in its true white glory. Set into it are four sockets, arranged in a two by two square.

[Welcome to a short story called "Balances", one of the example games for the Inform design system. Some people may recognise the setting, but others might like to type "how do spells work" - the game responds to a few such questions.] 

You feel a little confused as to how you got here. Something to do with Helistar!  That's right, and how the world is so far off balance nowadays, after the Great Change.

Ramshackle Hut
Until quite recently, someone lived here, you feel sure. Now the furniture is matchwood and the windows are glassless. Outside, it is a warm, sunny day, and grasslands extend to the low hills on the horizon.

state:
Pocket Valley
A pleasant pocket valley in the grassy hills, through which a trail runs north-to-south.
There is a chestnut horse here, munching on a pile of oats.
next_state: You close the cedarwood box.

state:
Sifting through the oats, you find a shiny scroll!  Lucky you got to it before the horse did. As you turn it over in your hands, it seems undamaged.

[Your score has just gone up by five points.]

state: The scroll reads "bozbar spell: cause an animal to sprout wings".

state: Your spell book begins to glow softly. Slowly, ornately, the words of the bozbar spell are inscribed, glowing even more brightly then the book itself. The book's brightness fades, but the spell remains! However, the scroll on which it was written vanishes as the last word is copied.
next_state: Using your best study habits, you commit the bozbar spell to memory.

state: A pair of handsome brown wings suddenly appears on the horse's powerful shoulders. The horse turns in a complete circle, a look of puzzlement on his face.
next_state: Dropped.

state:
You begin to ride north. Then, slowly at first but with increasing sureness, the horse begins beating its powerful wings. You rise majestically through the air, sailing gracefully across a chasm where the hills fall away. The horse lands gently on the far side and deposits you, taking to the skies again.

Edge of Chasm
The road ends suddenly at a wide chasm. The road leads upward to the north, and you can see it continuing on the southern side of the chasm.

Lying in a tight coil at the edge of the chasm is a hissing snake.

The snake appears to be curled around a featureless white cube.
next_state:
Crest of Hill
The road crosses the top of a ridge here, sloping downwards to the south and the northwest. A track diverges to east.

A tortoise ambles along the road, extremely slowly.

This is a cave mouth, at one end of a road which winds southeast over rising ground. The entrance west to the caves is a dark tunnel, and only a footpath runs further north, into gorse.

The footpath from the cave mouth runs into dense, impenetrable gorse bushes. Perhaps it wasn't so much a footpath as a rill in the earth where roots wouldn't take; anyway, there's no way but back south.

Slung over one of the gorse bushes is a beautiful red carpet.

state:
The temple shakes and white light bathes you. Smoothly it unfolds itself in a four-dimensional way your senses can barely comprehend. All you know is that when it is over, you find yourself in...

Balance Room
This seems to be the inside of a featureless white cube, forty feet on a side. The air is stale and there is no exit.

The image of a pair of scales hangs high in the air. One pan is much lower than the other.

Far below the scales, in the centre of the "floor", is a predictably-shaped podium, but it is so dusty and cobwebbed that you can't see what it once was.

[Your score has just gone up by five points.]
next_state:
(the frotz spell)
frotz spell: cause an object to give off light.

state: No substitute for old-fashioned hard work, sometimes, and after much patient (sneezy) scrubbing, the podium appears in its true white glory. Set into it are four sockets, arranged in a two by two square.
action: put chasm cube in bottom left socket
next_state: The cube is a predictably perfect fit in the socket.

state: The cube is a predictably perfect fit in the socket.
action: put cave cube in bottom right socket
next_state: The cube is a predictably perfect fit in the socket.

state: The cube is a predictably perfect fit in the socket.
next_state: Dropped.

state: The cube is a predictably perfect fit in the socket.
action: put mace cube in top right socket
next_state:
As you place the final cube into the sockets, you feel imbued with celestial wisdom (more so than usually). You find yourself growing to the height of the cube, so that you pull the balances back level by hand, and then you grow still further, out of the temple until it is but a cube in your hand, and you are a giant towering over the land. 

Then, of course, you wake up, glumly realising it's time to go to your job at the new Borphee Laboratories and all those Wheatstone bridge experiments. But at least you can dream about the old days.


    *** You have won ***


In that game you scored 50 out of a possible 51, in 122 turns, earning you the rank of Scientist.

[Welcome to a short story called "Balances", one of the example games for the Inform design system. Some people may recognise the setting, but others might like to type "how do spells work" - the game responds to a few such questions.] 

You feel a little confused as to how you got here. Something to do with Helistar!  That's right, and how the world is so far off balance nowadays, after the Great Change.

Ramshackle Hut
Until quite recently, someone lived here, you feel sure. Now the furniture is matchwood and the windows are glassless. Outside, it is a warm, sunny day, and grasslands extend to the low hills on the horizon.

state:
You begin to ride north. Then, slowly at first but with increasing sureness, the horse begins beating its powerful wings. You rise majestically through the air, sailing gracefully across a chasm where the hills fall away. The horse lands gently on the far side and deposits you, taking to the skies again.

Edge of Chasm
The road ends suddenly at a wide chasm. The road leads upward to the north, and you can see it continuing on the southern side of the chasm.

Lying in a tight coil at the edge of the chasm is a hissing snake.

The snake appears to be curled around a featureless white cube.

Gorse Bushes
The footpath from the cave mouth runs into dense, impenetrable gorse bushes. Perhaps it wasn't so much a footpath as a rill in the earth where roots wouldn't take; anyway, there's no way but back south.

Slung over one of the gorse bushes is a beautiful red carpet.

state:
There is an almost blinding flash of light as the silver coin begins to glow!  It slowly fades to a less painful level, but the silver coin is now quite usable as a light source.

Inside Cave
A wide but shallow cave not far inside the hill. There is no obvious exit, except for the way you came in.

The iron door stands open.

Balanced on a rock formation is a featureless white cube.

A fair-sized pair of scales hangs from a bracket in the cave wall. The scales are balanced.

On the right pan are three gold coins.

On the left pan are a bronze coin, two gold coins and a crumpled scroll.

next_state:
The temple shakes and white light bathes you. Smoothly it unfolds itself in a four-dimensional way your senses can barely comprehend. All you know is that when it is over, you find yourself in...

Balance Room
This seems to be the inside of a featureless white cube, forty feet on a side. The air is stale and there is no exit.

The image of a pair of scales hangs high in the air. One pan is much lower than the other.

Far below the scales, in the centre of the "floor", is a predictably-shaped podium, but it is so dusty and cobwebbed that you can't see what it once was.

state:
[Welcome to a short story called "Balances", one of the example games for the Inform design system. Some people may recognise the setting, but others might like to type "how do spells work" - the game responds to a few such questions.] 

You feel a little confused as to how you got here. Something to do with Helistar!  That's right, and how the world is so far off balance nowadays, after the Great Change.

Ramshackle Hut
Until quite recently, someone lived here, you feel sure. Now the furniture is matchwood and the windows are glassless. Outside, it is a warm, sunny day, and grasslands extend to the low hills on the horizon.

Grasslands, near Hut
The grasslands sway over low hills in all directions: it is a peaceful wilderness, broken only by this hut and a faint path to the north.

state:
Grasslands, near Hut
The grasslands sway over low hills in all directions: it is a peaceful wilderness, broken only by this hut and a faint path to the north.
next_state:
Helistar's grimoire: Done.
spell book: Done.
silver coin: Done.
magic burin: Done.

state:
Pocket Valley
A pleasant pocket valley in the grassy hills, through which a trail runs north-to-south.
There is a chestnut horse here, munching on a pile of oats.
next_state: You close the cedarwood box.

state:
Sifting through the oats, you find a shiny scroll!  Lucky you got to it before the horse did. As you turn it over in your hands, it seems undamaged.

[Your score has just gone up by five points.]
next_state:
This must be the grimoire of dangerous spells kept by your irresponsible friend Helistar. Many pages are missing, but a few spells remain:

frotz spell: cause an object to give off light.
lleps spell: reverse effect of memorised spell.
mortin spell: cause immediate death of caster.

state: The scroll reads "bozbar spell: cause an animal to sprout wings".
next_state: Your spell book begins to glow softly. Slowly, ornately, the words of the bozbar spell are inscribed, glowing even more brightly then the book itself. The book's brightness fades, but the spell remains! However, the scroll on which it was written vanishes as the last word is copied.

state: Your spell book begins to glow softly. Slowly, ornately, the words of the bozbar spell are inscribed, glowing even more brightly then the book itself. The book's brightness fades, but the spell remains! However, the scroll on which it was written vanishes as the last word is copied.
next_state: Using your best study habits, you commit the bozbar spell to memory.

state: Using your best study habits, you commit the bozbar spell to memory.
next_state: A pair of handsome brown wings suddenly appears on the horse's powerful shoulders. The horse turns in a complete circle, a look of puzzlement on his face.

state: A pair of handsome brown wings suddenly appears on the horse's powerful shoulders. The horse turns in a complete circle, a look of puzzlement on his face.
next_state:
You begin to ride north. Then, slowly at first but with increasing sureness, the horse begins beating its powerful wings. You rise majestically through the air, sailing gracefully across a chasm where the hills fall away. The horse lands gently on the far side and deposits you, taking to the skies again.

Edge of Chasm
The road ends suddenly at a wide chasm. The road leads upward to the north, and you can see it continuing on the southern side of the chasm.

Lying in a tight coil at the edge of the chasm is a hissing snake.

The snake appears to be curled around a featureless white cube.

Crest of Hill
The road crosses the top of a ridge here, sloping downwards to the south and the northwest. A track diverges to east.

A tortoise ambles along the road, extremely slowly.
next_state: Using your best study habits, you commit the yomin spell to memory.

state:
Cave Mouth
This is a cave mouth, at one end of a road which winds southeast over rising ground. The entrance west to the caves is a dark tunnel, and only a footpath runs further north, into gorse.
A heavy iron door bars the cave mouth.

Clotted in the mud beside the door is a perfect sapphire.
next_state: Crest of Hill

state: Taken.
next_state: As you gaze into the perfect blue of the sapphire, you feel your mind begin to reel. Unable to bear the naked sight of perfection, you look away, ashamed. As you do so, the sapphire cracks and wastes away to thin hot dust. But something remains, something in your mind...

Gorse Bushes
The footpath from the cave mouth runs into dense, impenetrable gorse bushes. Perhaps it wasn't so much a footpath as a rill in the earth where roots wouldn't take; anyway, there's no way but back south.

Slung over one of the gorse bushes is a beautiful red carpet.

next_state:
There is an almost blinding flash of light as the silver coin begins to glow!  It slowly fades to a less painful level, but the silver coin is now quite usable as a light source.

Inside Cave
A wide but shallow cave not far inside the hill. There is no obvious exit, except for the way you came in.

The iron door stands open.

Balanced on a rock formation is a featureless white cube.

A fair-sized pair of scales hangs from a bracket in the cave wall. The scales are balanced.

On the right pan are three gold coins.

On the left pan are a bronze coin, two gold coins and a crumpled scroll.

Far above you, a tortoise flaps across the sun.
next_state: Dropped.

state: Dropped.
next_state: You put Helistar's grimoire into the cedarwood box.

state:
The cuddly toy elephant is replaced by a buck-toothed cyclops wielding a mace!

The cyclops leaps and bellows!
next_state:
The caskly and gnusto spells are yours forever. Other than that, you have the yomin spell memorised.

High in the sky, a tortoise flaps across the sun.

The cyclops is losing patience (the appropriate cyclops word is untranslatable into English, but approximately means "forbearance in not smashing all nearby skulls").

next_state: The mace turns into a featureless white cube just as the cyclops was about to hit you with it. Mightily embarrassed by this, he drops the cube and runs off!

state:
Track, outside Temple

You stand outside an enormous temple in the shape of a perfect, featureless white cube, four hundred feet on a side. From somewhere within you hear the tiny sound of the monks chanting.

Far above you, a tortoise flaps across the sun.
next_state: You put Helistar's grimoire into the cedarwood box.

state: Using your best study habits, you commit the frotz spell to memory.
next_state:
The temple shakes and white light bathes you. Smoothly it unfolds itself in a four-dimensional way your senses can barely comprehend. All you know is that when it is over, you find yourself in...

Balance Room
This seems to be the inside of a featureless white cube, forty feet on a side. The air is stale and there is no exit.

The image of a pair of scales hangs high in the air. One pan is much lower than the other.

Far below the scales, in the centre of the "floor", is a predictably-shaped podium, but it is so dusty and cobwebbed that you can't see what it once was.

[Your score has just gone up by five points.]

next_state: Which do you mean, the frotz spell, the lleps spell, the mortin spell, the gnusto spell, the yomin spell, the rezrov spell, the bozbar spell, the caskly spell, the lobal spell or the urbzig spell?

state: No substitute for old-fashioned hard work, sometimes, and after much patient (sneezy) scrubbing, the podium appears in its true white glory. Set into it are four sockets, arranged in a two by two square.
next_state: You put the beautiful red carpet on the podium.

state: The cube is a predictably perfect fit in the socket.
action: put cave cube in bottom right socket
next_state: The cube is a predictably perfect fit in the socket.

state: The cube is a predictably perfect fit in the socket.
action: put prize cube in top left socket
next_state: The cube is a predictably perfect fit in the socket.

state: The cube is a predictably perfect fit in the socket.
action: put mace cube in top right socket
next_state:
As you place the final cube into the sockets, you feel imbued with celestial wisdom (more so than usually). You find yourself growing to the height of the cube, so that you pull the balances back level by hand, and then you grow still further, out of the temple until it is but a cube in your hand, and you are a giant towering over the land. 

Then, of course, you wake up, glumly realising it's time to go to your job at the new Borphee Laboratories and all those Wheatstone bridge experiments. But at least you can dream about the old days.


    *** You have won ***


In that game you scored 50 out of a possible 51, in 122 turns, earning you the rank of Scientist.

Would you like to RESTART, RESTORE a saved game or QUIT

state:
[Welcome to a short story called "Balances", one of the example games for the Inform design system. Some people may recognise the setting, but others might like to type "how do spells work" - the game responds to a few such questions.] 

You feel a little confused as to how you got here. Something to do with Helistar!  That's right, and how the world is so far off balance nowadays, after the Great Change.


BALANCES
An Interactive Short Story

Standard interpreter 1.0

Ramshackle Hut
Until quite recently, someone lived here, you feel sure. Now the furniture is matchwood and the windows are glassless. Outside, it is a warm, sunny day, and grasslands extend to the low hills on the horizon.
next_state:
Searching through the furniture, which is good for nothing but firewood now, you come across an old cedarwood box, which you pick up for a closer look.

[Your score has just gone up by five points.]

The grasslands sway over low hills in all directions: it is a peaceful wilderness, broken only by this hut and a faint path to the north.

state:
Pocket Valley
A pleasant pocket valley in the grassy hills, through which a trail runs north-to-south.
There is a chestnut horse here, munching on a pile of oats.
next_state: You put Helistar's grimoire into the cedarwood box.

state:
Sifting through the oats, you find a shiny scroll!  Lucky you got to it before the horse did. As you turn it over in your hands, it seems undamaged.

[Your score has just gone up by five points.]
next_state: You close the cedarwood box.

state: The scroll reads "bozbar spell: cause an animal to sprout wings".
next_state: Your spell book begins to glow softly. Slowly, ornately, the words of the bozbar spell are inscribed, glowing even more brightly then the book itself. The book's brightness fades, but the spell remains! However, the scroll on which it was written vanishes as the last word is copied.

state: Your spell book begins to glow softly. Slowly, ornately, the words of the bozbar spell are inscribed, glowing even more brightly then the book itself. The book's brightness fades, but the spell remains! However, the scroll on which it was written vanishes as the last word is copied.
next_state: Using your best study habits, you commit the bozbar spell to memory.

state: Using your best study habits, you commit the bozbar spell to memory.
next_state: A pair of handsome brown wings suddenly appears on the horse's powerful shoulders. The horse turns in a complete circle, a look of puzzlement on his face.

state: A pair of handsome brown wings suddenly appears on the horse's powerful shoulders. The horse turns in a complete circle, a look of puzzlement on his face.
next_state:
You begin to ride north. Then, slowly at first but with increasing sureness, the horse begins beating its powerful wings. You rise majestically through the air, sailing gracefully across a chasm where the hills fall away. The horse lands gently on the far side and deposits you, taking to the skies again.

Edge of Chasm
The road ends suddenly at a wide chasm. The road leads upward to the north, and you can see it continuing on the southern side of the chasm.

Lying in a tight coil at the edge of the chasm is a hissing snake.

The snake appears to be curled around a featureless white cube.

Cave Mouth
This is a cave mouth, at one end of a road which winds southeast over rising ground. The entrance west to the caves is a dark tunnel, and only a footpath runs further north, into gorse.
A heavy iron door bars the cave mouth.

Clotted in the mud beside the door is a perfect sapphire.
next_state: Taken.

state: Taken.
next_state: The scroll has faded, and you cannot read it.

state: As you gaze into the perfect blue of the sapphire, you feel your mind begin to reel. Unable to bear the naked sight of perfection, you look away, ashamed. As you do so, the sapphire cracks and wastes away to thin hot dust. But something remains, something in your mind...

Gorse Bushes
The footpath from the cave mouth runs into dense, impenetrable gorse bushes. Perhaps it wasn't so much a footpath as a rill in the earth where roots wouldn't take; anyway, there's no way but back south.

Slung over one of the gorse bushes is a beautiful red carpet.

state:
There is an almost blinding flash of light as the silver coin begins to glow!  It slowly fades to a less painful level, but the silver coin is now quite usable as a light source.

Inside Cave
A wide but shallow cave not far inside the hill. There is no obvious exit, except for the way you came in.

The iron door stands open.

Balanced on a rock formation is a featureless white cube.

A fair-sized pair of scales hangs from a bracket in the cave wall. The scales are balanced.

On the right pan are three gold coins.

On the left pan are a bronze coin, two gold coins and a crumpled scroll.

The carpet rises suddenly into the fluffy white clouds, and after a headlong journey deposits you...

Crowded Bazaar (on the beautiful red carpet)
This is a crowded, noisy bazaar. Directly in front of you is a lottery!  But the contemptuous-looking barker is doing a very poor trade: hardly anyone wants his first prize, the big cuddly toy elephant, or even his nineteenth prize, a featureless white cube.

Behind the barker is a huge drilled board, and inside each little numbered hole is a rolled-up lottery ticket.

"This could be your lucky day!"

This is a crowded, noisy bazaar. Directly in front of you is a lottery!  But the contemptuous-looking barker is doing a very poor trade: hardly anyone wants his first prize, the big cuddly toy elephant, or even his nineteenth prize, a featureless white cube.

Behind the barker is a huge drilled board, and inside each little numbered hole is a rolled-up lottery ticket.

"Come on, then!  Just a silver coin gets you three!"

state:
The temple shakes and white light bathes you. Smoothly it unfolds itself in a four-dimensional way your senses can barely comprehend. All you know is that when it is over, you find yourself in...

Balance Room
This seems to be the inside of a featureless white cube, forty feet on a side. The air is stale and there is no exit.

The image of a pair of scales hangs high in the air. One pan is much lower than the other.

Far below the scales, in the centre of the "floor", is a predictably-shaped podium, but it is so dusty and cobwebbed that you can't see what it once was.

[Your score has just gone up by five points.]
next_state: No substitute for old-fashioned hard work, sometimes, and after much patient (sneezy) scrubbing, the podium appears in its true white glory. Set into it are four sockets, arranged in a two by two square.

state: No substitute for old-fashioned hard work, sometimes, and after much patient (sneezy) scrubbing, the podium appears in its true white glory. Set into it are four sockets, arranged in a two by two square.
next_state: You put the magic burin into the cedarwood box.

state: The cube is a predictably perfect fit in the socket.
action: put cave cube in bottom right socket
next_state: The cube is a predictably perfect fit in the socket.

state: The cube is a predictably perfect fit in the socket.
action: put prize cube in top left socket
next_state: The cube is a predictably perfect fit in the socket.

state: The cube is a predictably perfect fit in the socket.
action: put mace cube in top right socket
next_state:
As you place the final cube into the sockets, you feel imbued with celestial wisdom (more so than usually). You find yourself growing to the height of the cube, so that you pull the balances back level by hand, and then you grow still further, out of the temple until it is but a cube in your hand, and you are a giant towering over the land. 

Then, of course, you wake up, glumly realising it's time to go to your job at the new Borphee Laboratories and all those Wheatstone bridge experiments. But at least you can dream about the old days.


    *** You have won ***


In that game you scored 50 out of a possible 51, in 122 turns, earning you the rank of Scientist.

state:
[Welcome to a short story called "Balances", one of the example games for the Inform design system. Some people may recognise the setting, but others might like to type "how do spells work" - the game responds to a few such questions.] 

You feel a little confused as to how you got here. Something to do with Helistar!  That's right, and how the world is so far off balance nowadays, after the Great Change.

Ramshackle Hut
Until quite recently, someone lived here, you feel sure. Now the furniture is matchwood and the windows are glassless. Outside, it is a warm, sunny day, and grasslands extend to the low hills on the horizon.

The grasslands sway over low hills in all directions: it is a peaceful wilderness, broken only by this hut and a faint path to the north.

state:
This must be the grimoire of dangerous spells kept by your irresponsible friend Helistar. Many pages are missing, but a few spells remain:

frotz spell: cause an object to give off light.
lleps spell: reverse effect of memorised spell.
mortin spell: cause immediate death of caster.

state:
You begin to ride north. Then, slowly at first but with increasing sureness, the horse begins beating its powerful wings. You rise majestically through the air, sailing gracefully across a chasm where the hills fall away. The horse lands gently on the far side and deposits you, taking to the skies again.

Edge of Chasm
The road ends suddenly at a wide chasm. The road leads upward to the north, and you can see it continuing on the southern side of the chasm.

Lying in a tight coil at the edge of the chasm is a hissing snake.

The snake appears to be curled around a featureless white cube.
next_state: You put Helistar's grimoire into the cedarwood box.

This is a cave mouth, at one end of a road which winds southeast over rising ground. The entrance west to the caves is a dark tunnel, and only a footpath runs further north, into gorse.
A heavy iron door bars the cave mouth.

Clotted in the mud beside the door is a perfect sapphire.

The footpath from the cave mouth runs into dense, impenetrable gorse bushes. Perhaps it wasn't so much a footpath as a rill in the earth where roots wouldn't take; anyway, there's no way but back south.

There is an almost blinding flash of light as the silver coin begins to glow!  It slowly fades to a less painful level, but the silver coin is now quite usable as a light source.

Inside Cave
A wide but shallow cave not far inside the hill. There is no obvious exit, except for the way you came in.

The iron door stands open.

Balanced on a rock formation is a featureless white cube.

A fair-sized pair of scales hangs from a bracket in the cave wall. The scales are balanced.

On the right pan are three gold coins.

On the left pan are a bronze coin, two gold coins and a crumpled scroll.

Crowded Bazaar (on the beautiful red carpet)
This is a crowded, noisy bazaar. Directly in front of you is a lottery!  But the contemptuous-looking barker is doing a very poor trade: hardly anyone wants his first prize, the big cuddly toy elephant, or even his nineteenth prize, a featureless white cube.

Behind the barker is a huge drilled board, and inside each little numbered hole is a rolled-up lottery ticket.

"This could be your lucky day!"

state:
The temple shakes and white light bathes you. Smoothly it unfolds itself in a four-dimensional way your senses can barely comprehend. All you know is that when it is over, you find yourself in...

Balance Room
This seems to be the inside of a featureless white cube, forty feet on a side. The air is stale and there is no exit.

The image of a pair of scales hangs high in the air. One pan is much lower than the other.

Far below the scales, in the centre of the "floor", is a predictably-shaped podium, but it is so dusty and cobwebbed that you can't see what it once was.

[Your score has just gone up by five points.]
next_state:
(the yomin spell)
That must be either vegetable or mineral.
